reviews.text: I was upgraded for free from Superior Room to Premier Room. The rooms are new, excellent quality, spacious and modern. Quality is even better than many 5 star hotels in Singapore, breakfast is good and very good service.
reviews.title: Premier wing is excellent

reviews.text: Price on high range, but this is Singapore recently. Position is excellent, close to MRT and within walking distance to many attractions. Looks more like a business hotel rather than vacation hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic rooms

reviews.text: I took a room in the premier wing of the Carlton hotel. I was on a business trip so I could not use the other facilities that the hotel provides. The rooms are spacious, and the bathroom extremely clean and modern...nice experience. The service was also good and all in all, a very pleasurable experience here as compared to other similar priced hotels in the area.
reviews.title: It became comical.... one mistake after another

reviews.text: Had a terrible experience at this hotel - arrived and no room was available despite a booking and confirmation, air conditioning could not be regulated ( freezing), breakfast buffet eggs and baked beans were cold as the heater had been turned off when I told the wait staff they said that is deliberate and perhaps I would like another dish which they do serve hot.
reviews.title: Excellent Location Friendly Staff

reviews.text: We had a room change which was meant to happen during the day but actually our bags were put in storage - including refrigerated products and when we returned at night we did not have a room. Then we were given a queen bed room when we wanted a twin. Then we were put in a smoking room although we specificaly asked for a non smoking. We were told it was non smoking but they put ashtrays in the room anyhow ??????
reviews.title: Comfortable Premier room

reviews.text: Excellent location, very helpful staff, good standard of accommodation and well prepared food. Exactly what visitors on a city break require.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: A very average business hotel. The location is good and is in the middle of down town singapore and very close to Raffles Hotel. The reception area is very nice, the room itself was average - nothing wrong with it, just a bit plain and ordinary looking. The internet wasn't included so you need to pay to use it. The rooms were not so clean and it looks bit run down. The hotel can be quite crowded since it's a crew hotel for many airlines. Overall, an ok hotel for a quick stopover
reviews.title: An average business hotel

reviews.text: Stayed over on the way to australia, and the breakfast was nice and varied. The pool on the side of the building, halfway up was amazing at night, for the view of the city (and the weather).
reviews.title: Good food and pool

reviews.text: The room was fine, we were given an upgrade but frankly there is no difference apart from the slightly better tiling in the bathroom and a bathrobe- just the one mind, not two! Honestly not worth upgrading. Location is excellent near Raffles city so good links and food courts. Staff are very helpful and breakfast buffet is excellent. Shame about the rooms, this used to be a 5 star years ago but it is looking tired. Now its more a low 4 star. Could do with a refurb.
reviews.title: Ok- not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the convenient location of this hotel. There were several restaurants and shops within walking distance and when we did need a cab, it was an inexpensive ride.
reviews.title: Good location, good hotel

reviews.text: This is a fairly large hotel and with that, it feels a bit impersonal. When we booked the room, we were told we'd be in the 'new' wing as an upgrade. This hotel has a few wings and while I think we were in a 'new-er' section, it certainly wasn't brand new. The carpet had stains and you could see the distress in the bathroom. The room was nice and spacious which was a bonus being that many hotels in Singapore have such tiny rooms.
reviews.title: nice, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this place for a day. I found that was the hotel was conveniently located and the rooms are neat and clean. The lobby is impressive. Clark quay is just walking distance from here, so is Bugis. I would still recommend marina bay sands over this one any day though.
reviews.title: A good Place

reviews.text: We booked online and were picked up at the airport on time. The CARLTON is a big hotel in the middle of Singapore, a small walk behind the RAFFLES. The entrance hall is huge and let you expect a 1st class hotel. But on the way to your room you will realize that you not have booked a five star hotel. The gangways are not very clean, the rooms are nothing special, they are ok but definitely not to stay fore a long time. Internet is not free, the minibar is small assorted and overpriced.
reviews.title: Great location in the heart of Singapore, but not a 5* hotel at all.

reviews.text: We loved it because you are near to the MRT station and can reach every point of Singapore very easily. Even by feet you are able to reach the big shopping malls, the harbour or many other places of interest.
reviews.title: Chaos at Carlton!!

reviews.text: I think it is overpriced but even like that it is not easy to get free rooms. The pool is huge, clean and something of the best this hotel offers.
reviews.title: Definately NOT a 5 star Hotel!!!! Try Traders, they are excellent.

reviews.text: I was traveling to Singapore on a Business trip and took the late night Singapore Airlines flight from Bangalore which reaches Singapore at 6ish in the morning. The bookings for the stay were done in Australia from my head office and The Hotel was informed that I'd need a early check in, when I reached there the front office staff they denied having any information. They asked me to wait in the lobby, I was sleepy, hungry and irate, waited there for three hours and then they got my room ready.
reviews.title: Carlton Singapore a decent place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and easy to get to from the airport. Walk to marina and river and one train stop from Orchard Road. Lovely room and a pool to boot. This was an amazing find on Expedia that really surprised us for the price.
reviews.title: Really liked this one!

reviews.text: Stayed here on two occasions in the last month or so. The location is good, next to Chimes and within walking distance to Arab Street. Also a short cab ride to Orchard and of course, it's across the street from Raffles Hotel. Breakfast was above average and the gym facility is newly renovated with good equipment. The rooms however, are a bit dated and ventilation in the hotel could be better. Smoking floors are interspersed in the hotel and I could smell smoke in my room from time to time. Acquired a nagging cough during the stay and I'm pretty convinced it was due to air quality.
reviews.title: Decent location, but poor cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and friendly helpful service, but the rooms and corridors are looking tired and dated in need of refurbishment, especially as they are still charging top dollar.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a good Location but looking a bit dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending 4 weeks travelling through Europe, we decided to treat ourselves to 3 days in Singapore on the way home to Australia. We stayed in London, Paris and Prague and this was the most expensive hotel and the worst quality of all of them. We arrived early and as was to be expected, our room wasn't ready. The staff were pleasant, took our luggage, although it was stored in the public area with no security. In fact, we went to our bags a couple without anyone questioning us. The staff told us to come back in 3 hours and our room would be ready. Which it was. When we got to our room, it was a twin, not the king we had booked and it was obviously a smokers room, something we had definitely not requested. Rang downstairs and asked to be moved to a room with a king bed. Staff were very confused and eventually we found someone who could help us. Despite our voucher stating all of this as well as an upgrade, we had to constantly point this out. Finally got upgraded further and received a king room. Room was very tired.. In fact the whole floor was tired. Bed was very hard and uncomfortable.The carpet in the rooms and hallways have massive stains. Carpet definitely needs to be replaced. Bathroom was nice. Found unfortunately, the person staying in the room next door smoked in their bathroom, so our bathroom stank of smoke. Buffet breakfast was ok, but a lot of the hot food was luke warm at best. If you can, avoid the 8-9 rush, as this is when the business people are there and there are no tables. Overall staff are nice. Very average hotel, but great location. There are several other hotels nearby, Swisshotel Stamford and Fairmont. Maybe they are of a better quality. Wouldn't recommend if there were other choices available. Biggest disappointment was no wifi (forget that it wasn't free as it was in every other hotel we stayed in). You need a laptop in the rooms, so if you have a smartphone, absolutely no use what so ever. Wifi is only available in the lobby. Not where I like to do my business or personal stuff...
reviews.title: Very tired hotel. Overpriced for what it is. No WIFI (free or otherwise) in rooms !

reviews.text: Arrived at 1am for a night stopover in Singapore, nobody at the front lobby door, not until they see me dragging my suitcases with my wife and 2 kids, then they chased us to help dragged our 2 big suitcase. Requested a King bed, got me a twin room with two single bed. The ladies on the reception were cold and snobbish, kind a prejudice and racist toward us Indonesians, no smile, once i asked why "twin bedrooms, just answered, sorry fully booked!, What??, hello, i paid already!.Tiny beds! the indian porter who helped our luggage try his best to put us on a king bed room and yes he did managed us to moved to a smoking floor with a king bed as i requested and confirmed by the hotel email letter. The room suprisingly doesnt smell of any smoke or bad dusty smell. excellent.
reviews.title: Cold and Snobbish Check in
